snippet: Retired police officers and firefighters were among those accused in a decades-long scheme in which false mental disability claims cost taxpayers hundreds of millions of dollars, according to court papers.
abstract: Manhattan District Attorney Cyrus R Vance Jr announces arrest of 106 people, including 80 retired New York City police officers and firefighters, charged with faking Social Security disability claims as part of decades-long fraud that has cost federal government estimated $400 million; many of those charged had received disability payments for psychiatric disorders that they falsely claimed were result of Sept 11 attacks.

byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and JAMES C. McKINLEY Jr
byline.contributor: Susan C. Beachy and Kitty Bennett contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Retired police officers and firefighters were among those accused in a decades-long scheme in which false mental disability claims cost taxpayers hundreds of millions of dollars, according to court papers.

headline.main: Charges for 106 in Huge Fraud Over Disability
headline.print_headline: 106 Are Charged in Lengthy Fraud Over Disabilities
